titleStmt.title: J. H. Johnson et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11000

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Frankfort Ky. Nov. 3rd 1861
To his Excellency
Governor Beriah Magoffin

The undersigned your petitioners pray that you will remit a fine assessed aginst William P. Watson of this City on a charge of disorderly conduct, Said fine in the opinion of your petitioners is excessive excessive amounting, ^to ten dollars^ with costs as it does to $13.75 and as the offense injured no one, therefore they pray Executive clemency

Very Respectfully
J H Johnson
W. L. Harlan
John M Todd James M Todd
S Sanders
E P Bowman
J. W. Pruett
A. C. Keenor
R K Woodson

$10 } Breach
Wm P. Watson
Issd Nov 19. 1861
